title: Google\Cloud\Build\V1\BuildTrigger
name: BuildTrigger
description:
Configuration for an automated build in response to source repository changes.

Generated from protobuf message google.devtools.cloudbuild.v1.BuildTrigger

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.id
params.description: Output only. Unique identifier of the trigger.

params.name: data.description
params.description: Human-readable description of this trigger.

params.name: data.name
params.description: User-assigned name of the trigger. Must be unique within the project. Trigger names must meet the following requirements: + They must contain only alphanumeric characters and dashes. + They can be 1-64 characters long. + They must begin and end with an alphanumeric character.

params.name: data.tags
params.description: Tags for annotation of a BuildTrigger

params.name: data.trigger_template
params.description: Template describing the types of source changes to trigger a build. Branch and tag names in trigger templates are interpreted as regular expressions. Any branch or tag change that matches that regular expression will trigger a build. Mutually exclusive with github.

params.name: data.github
params.description: GitHubEventsConfig describes the configuration of a trigger that creates a build whenever a GitHub event is received. Mutually exclusive with trigger_template.

params.name: data.pubsub_config
params.description: Optional. PubsubConfig describes the configuration of a trigger that creates a build whenever a Pub/Sub message is published.

params.name: data.build
params.description: Contents of the build template.

params.name: data.filename
params.description: Path, from the source root, to the build configuration file (i.e. cloudbuild.yaml).

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. Time when the trigger was created.

params.name: data.disabled
params.description: If true, the trigger will never automatically execute a build.

params.name: data.substitutions
params.description: Substitutions for Build resource. The keys must match the following regular expression: ^_[A-Z0-9_]+$.

params.name: data.ignored_files
params.description: ignored_files and included_files are file glob matches using https://golang.org/pkg/path/filepath/#Match extended with support for "**". If ignored_files and changed files are both empty, then they are not used to determine whether or not to trigger a build. If ignored_files is not empty, then we ignore any files that match any of the ignored_file globs. If the change has no files that are outside of the ignored_files globs, then we do not trigger a build.

params.name: data.included_files
params.description: If any of the files altered in the commit pass the ignored_files filter and included_files is empty, then as far as this filter is concerned, we should trigger the build. If any of the files altered in the commit pass the ignored_files filter and included_files is not empty, then we make sure that at least one of those files matches a included_files glob. If not, then we do not trigger a build.

params.name: data.filter
params.description: Optional. A Common Expression Language string.

methods.name: getIgnoredFiles
methods.description:
ignored_files and included_files are file glob matches using https://golang.org/pkg/path/filepath/#Match extended with support for "**".

If ignored_files and changed files are both empty, then they are not used to determine whether or not to trigger a build. If ignored_files is not empty, then we ignore any files that match any of the ignored_file globs. If the change has no files that are outside of the ignored_files globs, then we do not trigger a build.

Generated from protobuf field repeated string ignored_files = 15;

methods.name: getIncludedFiles
methods.description:
If any of the files altered in the commit pass the ignored_files filter and included_files is empty, then as far as this filter is concerned, we should trigger the build.

If any of the files altered in the commit pass the ignored_files filter and included_files is not empty, then we make sure that at least one of those files matches a included_files glob. If not, then we do not trigger a build.
